overview: Cándido and Leonardo are two 18-year-olds who experience sensations at odds with the conventions of the time and tragically suffer the consequences of the machismo that condemns them. They grew up together, they lived their childhood with the normality that their difference in social class allowed them. Leonardo, son of the landowner, Candido, son of the foreman. They played marbles, cockerels (carob seed), climbed trees and bathed together in the river ... but they discovered each other ... they saw each other for the first time, in a different way.
title: Crisálida
